TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1161-1162
TEI.2.document_title: P Powell to Stephen F Austin, 07-30-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: P. Powell to Austin, July 30, 1825. Concerning land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1161-1162

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*P. Powell to Austin, July 30, 1825. Concerning land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dr Sir. *date_mentioned n="07-30-1825">30t July1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have understood that in consequence of the death of *person_mentioned*Mr. Garver*/person_mentioned* the league is of Course vacant that was intended for him even if the Deed is out there will not be the necessary improvement made to hold it I have thought proper to apprise you that I am willing to take that place You will inform me by *person_mentioned*Mr. Jamison*/person_mentioned*. If you do not grant me this I Have improved the *location_mentioned*seventh league in Bay Prarara*/location_mentioned* and shall rely upon the faith of the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*to attain it,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. Powell*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[Addressed :] *person_mentioned*Colo S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Filipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
